Plot a map and overlay data and/or geoprofile via leaflet

geoPlotMap2.Rd

Plots geoprofile on map, with various customisable options.

geoPlotMap2(params, data = NULL, surface = NULL, source = NULL,
  surfaceCols = c("#F0F921FF", "#FDC926FF", "#FA9E3BFF", "#ED7953FF",
  "#D8576BFF", "#BD3786FF", "#9C179EFF", "#7301A8FF", "#47039FFF",
  "#0D0887FF"), crimeCex = 1.5, crimeCol = "red", sourceCex = 1.5,
  sourceCol = "blue", map_type = 110, threshold = 0.1,
  opacity = 0.8, smoothing = 1, gpLegend = FALSE)

Arguments

params

parameters list in the format defined by geoParams().
data

data object in the format defined by geoData().
surface

a surface to overlay onto the map, typically a geoprofile obtained from the output of geoMCMC().
source

potential sources object in the format defined by geoDataSource().
surfaceCols

vector of two or more colours to plot surface. Defaults to viridis palette.
crimeCex

relative size of symbols showing crimes.
crimeCol

colour of crime symbols.
sourceCex

relative size of symbols showing suspect sites.
sourceCol

colour of suspect sites symbols.
map_type

the specific type of map to plot. See leaflet::providers for options.
threshold

what level of the geoprofile to display
opacity

value between 0 and 1 givin the opacity of surface colours.
smoothing

smooth profile
gpLegend

whether or not to add legend to plot.

Examples

# \donttest{
# London example data
d <- LondonExample_crimes
s <- LondonExample_sources
p <- geoParams(data = d, sigma_mean = 1.0, sigma_squared_shape = 2)

#> Using sigma_mean and sigma_squared_shape to define prior on sigma
#m <- geoMCMC(data = d, params = p)
# produce simple map
#geoPlotMap(params = p, data = d, source = s, surface = m$geoProfile,
#                breakPercent = seq(0, 50, 5), mapType = "hybrid",
#                crimeCol = "black", crimeCex = 2, sourceCol = "red", sourceCex = 2)

# John Snow cholera data
d <- Cholera
s <- WaterPumps
p <- geoParams(data = d, sigma_mean = 1.0, sigma_squared_shape = 2)

#> Using sigma_mean and sigma_squared_shape to define prior on sigma
#m <- geoMCMC(data = d, params = p, lambda=0.05)
# produce simple map
#geoPlotMap(params = p, data = d, source = s, surface = m$geoProfile,
#                breakPercent = seq(0, 50, 5), mapType = "hybrid",
#                crimeCol = "black", crimeCex = 2, sourceCol = "red", sourceCex = 2)

# simulated data
sim <-rDPM(50, priorMean_longitude = -0.04217491, priorMean_latitude = 
51.5235505, alpha=1, sigma=1, tau=3)
d <- geoData(sim$longitude, sim $latitude)
s <- geoDataSource(sim$source_lon, sim$source_lat)
p <- geoParams(data = d, sigma_mean = 1.0, sigma_squared_shape = 2)

#> Using sigma_mean and sigma_squared_shape to define prior on sigma
#m <- geoMCMC(data = d, params = p)
# change colour palette, map type, opacity and range of geoprofile and omit legend
#geoPlotMap(params = p, data = d, source = s, surface = m$geoProfile,
#                breakPercent = seq(0, 30, 5), mapType = "terrain", 
#                surfaceCols = c("blue","white"), crimeCol = "black", 
#                crimeBorderCol = "white",crimeCex = 2, sourceCol = "red", sourceCex = 2,
#                opacity = 0.7, gpLegend = FALSE)
# }
